data.snippet:

### Maven Screen Media Hires Anna Smith Tenser As Chief Content Officer](

[News  

### Apple TV's 'Criminal Record' Season 2 Reveals First Look & Premiere Date](

Since publication, the book has sold close to two million copies in 40+ territories and has been on the NYT list for 29 weeks. It has been selected as GMA Book Club Pick, NPR Book of the Year, People Magazine Book of the Week, Amazon Editors’ Pick, Indie Next List selection, Book of the Month Add On and Kirkus Book of the Year.

### Watch on Deadline

The screen adaptation will be executive-produced by Linda Rosensweig. [...] Got A Tip?

Got A Tip?   Tip Us

## Breaking News

  A24 Wins Olivia Wilde Film ‘The Invite’ For $10M+ In Sundance Bidding War

Read the full story

# Maven Screen Media Options Film Rights To Hit Historical-Mystery Novel ‘The Frozen River’

EXCLUSIVE: Trudie Styler and Celine Rattray’s Maven Screen Media (Eleanor The Great) have optioned film rights to Ariel Lawhon’s historical-mystery novel The Frozen River (2023). [...] Celine Rattray, co-founder of Maven Screen Media, added: “At Maven, we are committed to amplifying women’s voices and bringing their stories to the screen. Martha Ballard’s fight for truth and justice resonates powerfully today around the globe, and so we’re thrilled at the prospect of adapting this extraordinary novel into a cinematic experience that honours its historical setting, while speaking to the universal, timeless themes of resilience and integrity.”

San Jose Mayor Matt Mahan announced his run for California governor Thursday morning.

California Gov. Gavin Newsom has been accused of using social media to troll Republicans rather than address the state’s most pressing problems. GIAN EHRENZELLER/EPA/Shutterstock

San Jose's Mayor Mahan said he is running for California governor to address major issues such as homelessness and drug addiction. NWSL via Getty Images
